About Booster  At Booster we're driven to transform how energy gets delivered. Are you ready to disrupt a legacy business model that hasn't changed in 100 years in gas stations? By leveraging machine learning, IoT, and cloud technology, we empower our customers to visualize, streamline, and most importantly  decarbonize  fuel delivery. Each Boost saves our customers 1.1 lbs of CO₂ and $5-10 of labor, per vehicle, per day. What started in 2015 with our three founders and a truck is now a 350-employee rocketship poised to triple in 2022, and we're not just delivering gas–we've converted the majority of our diesel customers to 100% renewable biodiesel; more renewables are next.  About the Role  Booster Fuels is looking for a talented individual to join our accounting team! As the Fuel Purchases Accounts Payable Specialist your primary duties will revolve around fuel inventory purchases, working with fuel suppliers and ensuring that we are only paying for what we procured.  Location : We know not everyone wants to be in an office setting five days a week. At Booster we want to promote flexibility in our workforce, that's why we're open to welcoming applicants from across the U.S., especially those local to one of our hubs!  What You'll do   Daily validating DTN (fuel purchases 3rd party software) properly records invoices into NetSuite  Record invoices not processed by DTN directly into NetSuite  Apply payments to fuel purchases daily  Resolve and reconcile quantity discrepancies between BOLs and invoices by working directly with suppliers  DTN Mapping and maintenance of Fuel Admin portal  Onboarding new fuel supplies in DTN/NetSuite  Monthly reconciliation of BOLs, POs, Item Receipts, and invoices  Month end close reconciliation of fuel purchases received but not billed  Month end close accrual of BOLs   About you   Aligned with Booster's core values of  Safety, Integrity, Excellence, Bold, Stewardship  Business degree from accredited University (Accounting degree a plus)  5+ years Accounts Payable experience (Inventory AP experience a plus)  Experience with NetSuite a plus  Experience with DTN a plus  Ability to work in a flexible, fast paced, dynamic environment  Excel skills  Strong communication skills, both written and verbal  Positive, team-oriented attitude   Not sure if you meet the qualifications? Apply anyway! We're building a diverse team with perspectives from every industry. If you find yourself meeting some but not all of the above, we'd still love to hear from you!  What makes Booster different?   Committed to Equity and Inclusion  and you'll notice it in our process  Cutting edge tech:  We're building the world's first unified energy network  100% employer paid  medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance coverage for employees!  Unlimited PTO and up to 12 weeks of parental leave  Stock Options  at a fast-growing startup with strong VC backing   Check us out!  PR News Wire,  Booster's Mobile Energy Service Expands  Fleet Management Weekly,  Booster Expands its Mobile Energy Technology Platform to Include On-Demand Electric Vehicles Charging Capability  Dallas Innovates,  Booster Builds on Renewables Delivery Partnership  Booster continues to win awards:  Forbes Top Startup Employers 2021 ,  PRWeek's 2021 Hall of Femme ,  SVBJ's 2020 40 Under 40 ,  Business Intelligence Group's 2019 Sustainability Service of the Year , and  Women in Trucking's 2019 Top Companies for Women to Work for in Transportation . Familiarity with Advanced Analytics tools such as: Scala, R, Python, SQL, Matlab, SAS, SPSS, Minitab, Hive, Hadoop, Pig, Tableau, Spotfire, etc Expertise or demonstrable knowledge in Statistics, Big Data, Machine Learning, Data Science, IoT. Key to Hisco's  success is the fact that it is one of the original ESOP companies, where employees are the owners of the company.  As a  specialty distribution and fabrication company serving the electronic assembly, aerospace, defense, medical, electronics, and other industrial markets. With offices throughout the United States, Mexico and in Canada, it has successfully served its customers for over 50 years. Employee owners' goal is to continually improve services, warehousing, fabrication, automated inventory, packaging, and delivery with their signature fast, friendly service. Hisco offers a competitive pay structure for this role and a very rich benefit program. Job Description Supports operations, sales, leadership and marketing teams with insights gained from analyzing company data. Adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for pricing, demand and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. Must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. Must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. Must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes. Job Duties / Activities Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions. Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies. Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques. Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets. Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes. Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality. Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes. Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy. Join and participate in trade associations specific to roles and responsibilities Skills, Abilities, Knowledge Requirements Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis in distribution Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets. Experience working with and creating data architectures. Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, etc. Along with advanced machine learning algorithms, scenario analysis, clustering, neural networks, etc. Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python, SLQ, etc. Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (properties of distributions, statistical tests, and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications. Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams. Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using (Preferred)  Experience using web services: Redshift, S3, Spark, DigitalOcean, etc. (Preferred)  Experience analyzing data from 3rd party providers: Google Analytics, Site Catalyst, Coremetrics, Adwords, Crimson Hexagon, Facebook Insights, etc. (Preferred)  Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Gurobi, MySQL, etc. Education and Experience Bachelor’s Degree in mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field 3-5 years’ experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models, Working knowledge of accounting and finance Experience with industrial distribution or manufacturing Physical Demands Sitting for long periods of time in front of a computer Travel to other Hisco branch offices, trade shows, and customers may be required

Description   About Augmenta      At Augmenta, we’re on the mission of changing Agriculture by “smartly” automating the most critical agricultural operations, driving down costs, and improving crop performance.      Augmenta is a deep-tech company serving farmers and agricultural service providers with both intuitive and actionable solutions. Our company is the first in the sector globally, combining reliability with scalability. The technology is based on edge computing, multispectral computer vision, and AI to achieve an accurate perception of the farming environment (e.g. the canopy health) and automate tasks, such as fertilizer application. Our state-of-the-art machine learning tech and carefully designed hardware operate in real-time and the system "learns" the more it's used by the farmer. A typical farmer can increase his yield up to 15%, reduce the number of chemical field inputs by up to 20% and increase the quality of his field's end-product by 15%.      We are a diverse, agile, and cool team of top performers situated in different locations in Europe and the US. We care about each other, and our Culture & Values are immensely important for us. Trust is at the very heart of how we work; we have no fine print.      About our Values      No fine print      Ownership      Open & courageous communication      Servant leadership      Think like a farmer      Think big      About the Job      As the Director of Sales, you will be responsible for setting extremely high standards and achieving ambitious sales goals for Augmenta globally. You will be leading the entire global sales team and external sales-related partners. You will also be working closely with the Senior Leadership Team to develop the roadmap for realizing and offering new services in accordance with Augmenta’s vision. Finally, you will be responsible for creating, monitoring, and communicating metrics and KPIs relevant to the scope. The Sales Director will be reporting to the CEO. More specifically, you will:      Set up sales metrics and KPIs   Set up sales budgets   Set up sales pipeline through CRM tools   Analyze current sales strategy and suggest improvements   Manage strategic accounts and nurture strong relationships   Understand all the prospects' needs, problems, or wants   Sell Augmenta products and services to strategic accounts   Identify process bottlenecks   Meet with potential clients and partners   Identify customer persona profiles   Recruit, hire, and train new sales managers and representatives   Investigate leads and find out about them as much as possible before contacting   Track, monitor, and report metrics   Prepare and present reports   Review sales contracts   Stay up to date with the latest sales trends and best practices   Requirements      About you      First and foremost, we need everyone willing to join us to be a team player, great communicator, humble and aligned with our culture and values. Now about the job-specific specs:      Proven sales experience and extensive network in the Ag industry   Experience in scaling up sales teams   Highly engaged, hungry, agile, and data-driven mindset   Excellent proven record of successful deals closed   Ability to communicate, present, and influence all levels of the organization, including executive and C-level   Proven ability to drive the sales process from plan to close   Proven ability to articulate the distinct aspects of products and services   Proven ability to position products against competitors   Demonstrable experience as head of sales, developing client-focused, differentiated, and achievable solutions   Sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on the company’s success   Excellent listening, negotiation, and presentation skills   Good understanding of Marketing   Great knowledge of CRM and relevant tools   Critical thinker and great problem-solving skills   Excellent leadership skills   Excellent time-management skills   Excellent interpersonal skills   Strong experience with metrics and KPIs   Strong experience with budgeting and projections      Nice to have   Based in Austin, Texas   Experience in the BigTech industry      Benefits      About what we can offer      A competitive base salary with fast, results-driven raises.   Very strong bonus scheme.   Strong stock-options plan.   Private health insurance with options for full family coverage   Flexible working schedule.   Flexibility around remote work.   Continuous Training & Development on a personal and team level.   An open, dynamic, and cool environment in which trust is a guiding principle.   A fun, diverse, and global team of top performers who will help you grow.

Job Summary       The Face Research Lab (PI: Alice O’Toole) at UT Dallas invites applications for 1-2 postdoctoral scholar positions, to begin in Summer of 2022. We seek an innovative scholar with a PhD in Cognitive Science, Computer Vision, Psychology, Neuroscience, or related fields. Information about our lab and the work we do is available https://labs.utdallas.edu/facelab/projects/.    Minimum Education and Experience    Ph.D in a related field.  Preferred Education and Experience       We are especially interested in scholars with computational modeling background. Experience in programming is necessary, experience with R and Python are strong pluses. Background in human perception and neural networks/machine learning or a desire to learn is required.          An ideal candidate should possess (i) intellectual creativity and innovation, (2) a strong background in computational modeling, (iii) proficiency in data analysis, (iv) intellectual and practical autonomy, and (v) excellent organizational and interpersonal skills, including the capacity to work with collaborative teams.    Essential Duties and Responsibilities       Postdoc(s) will work on a collaborative project aimed at understanding the representation of faces in deep convolutional neural networks. The goal of the work is to determine whether these representations can serve as models of human visual processing of faces. The successful candidate(s) will join a collaborative project with computer vision scientists at Johns Hopkins University in carrying out studies that combine human face recognition experiments and computational modeling of the representations formed by deep networks.           Physical Activities Working Conditions Additional Information Special Instructions Summary       Interested applicants should contact Dr. Alice O’Toole (otoole@utdallas.edu) with a statement of interest (maximum: 2 pages), a CV, and 2 letters of reference. Submissions will be reviewed on a rolling basis, with priority given to submissions received before May 15th, 2022. The project is funded by the National Eye Institute.    Important Message    1) All employees serve as a representative of the University and are expected to display respect, civility, professional courtesy, consideration of others and discretion in all interactions with members of the UT Dallas community and the general public.      2) UT Dallas does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, genetic information, or veteran status in its programs and activities, including in admission and enrollment. For inquiries regarding non-discrimination policies, contact the Director of Institutional Equity at InstitutionalEquity@utdallas.edu or the Title IX Coordinator at TitleIXCoordinator@utdallas.edu, or call  972-883-5331 .

The Neuron team at CDK Global is built on understanding our customers' data more deeply than they do, and our data scientists are instrumental in that. In this role, you will dive deep into the automotive world and lead a team of data scientists to uncover, refine, and integrate complex data solutions to help our customers solve important business problems. We're a collaborative organization with an emphasis on iteration and learning. We’re looking for someone who is looking to have an immediate impact and ready to rise to the challenge of a growing organization. Sound like your kind of challenge? Dig in to learn more and read up on it at http://neuron.ai The Gig Manage a team of data scientists providing guidance & instruction as needed Lead full stack data science projects from idea generation to production implementation Collaborate with leadership to help design & implement new strategies Analyze data to recommend solutions to new and complex problems Gain a deep understanding of the automotive industry's sales and service operations About You 5+ years of experience working as a data scientist 2+ years of experience managing teams You love to dive deep into data and numbers You are a creative and curious thinker with the ability to translate business problems into data requirements You bring an understanding of statistics and a good intuition for data You've got experience with data querying (i.e., SQL), data analysis, and data visualization tools (i.e., Tableau) You're comfortable in Python and the Data Science stack (NumPy, Pandas, scikit-learn) You’re comfortable using Docker to expose models as REST APIs You’ve implemented production models using both real-time and batch scoring. You have worked with Bash or other shell scripting languages You’re innately curious and fanatical about learning You thrive in an agile environment and can drive agile best practices You like the diversity of your work as new challenges and projects come in We’re always looking for people to join and evolve our Neuron/CDK culture. We want you to bring your unique experience and perspective, so don’t worry about checking all the boxes. If our values and mission resonate with you, please apply! The Good Stuff Flexibility: no office dress code and time off whenever you need it! You won’t need to accrue time off, and you can structure your time to work with your life. We’re currently all working from home – once it’s safe to return to the office, you will have the choice on how often you work from the office. Diversity + Inclusion: we bring our full selves to work, and you can too! If you need to get away from your home office, choose from a cozy campus of 1920’s craftsman homes in downtown Austin or an office nestled in the hills of West Austin. Team lunches, stocked kitchen + bar, coffee-snob compliant coffee. Bi-annual Hackathons where we think outside of the box + experiment on our ideas! All of our benefits are effective the first day of employment! This includes a generous 401K matching, flexible paid time off, donating your time to volunteer in your community, and tuition reimbursement for furthering education. The CDK Culture  Our culture is at the core of everything we do. As we grow, we’re not only looking to hire the best and brightest, but we’re also looking for people to share + evolve our values forward. Own It. We seek accountability and act with integrity. We delight in taking responsibility, have positive intent, and we’re focused on the outcome of our efforts. Stay Curious. We listen to understand. We’re relentless innovators, open to new ideas, and we make decisions based on data. Be Open. We welcome respectful challenge to find new + better ways to work. We thrive on feedback, build open + agnostic technology, and encourage different views. Create Possibilities. We ask “how can we…” to make a difference in the world. We’re confident to grow, adapt, and celebrate our achievements. Join Our Team  Growth potential, flexibility, and material impact on the success and quality of a next-gen, enterprise software product makes CDK an excellent choice for those who thrive in challenging, fast-paced engineering environments. The possibilities for impact are endless. You'll have exceptional opportunities to evolve our industry by driving change through new technology.   If you’re ready for high-impact, you’re ready for CDK. At CDK, we believe inclusion and diversity are essential in inspiring meaningful connections to our people, customers and communities. We are open, curious and encourage different views, so that everyone can be their best selves and make an impact. CDK is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating an inclusive workforce where everyone is valued. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, ancestry, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, creed or religion, age, disability (including pregnancy), results of genetic testing, service in the military, veteran status or any other category protected by law. Applicants for employment in the US must be authorized to work in the US. CDK may offer employer visa sponsorship to applicants.

Summary  Posted: Oct 25, 2021  Weekly Hours:  40  Role Number: 200295935  Apple is a place where extraordinary people gather to do their best work. Together we create products and experiences people once couldn’t have envisioned — and now can’t imagine living without. If you’re excited by the idea of making a real impact, a career with Apple might be your ideal job… Just be prepared to dream big! The AppleCare Digital team is looking for an outstanding data scientist who is interested in designing, developing and identifying data mining solutions that have direct and measurable impact on AppleCare’s support operations. AppleCare has tremendous amount of data, and we have just begun exploration of the data in the areas of pattern detection, anomaly detection, predictive modeling, and optimization. The person in this position will work with various online business managers to help identify viable data mining opportunities and implement end-to-end analytical solutions. The role requires both a broad knowledge of data mining algorithms and creativity to invent and customize as appropriate. This position is located in Austin, Texas.  Key Qualifications  Proven experience in a Data Science role in the areas of Natural Language Processing, Data Mining, Machine Learning (ML), Statistics or related field. Experience crafting, conducting, analyzing, and interpreting experiments and investigations.  Experience articulating and translating business questions and using analytics and data science techniques to answer those questions.  Strong understanding of data science algorithms including tree based algorithms, probability networks, association rules, clustering, regression, and neural networks.  Experience partnering with internal teams to drive results and providing expertise and direction on analytics, data science, experimental design, and measurement.  Expertise in statistical data analysis such as linear models, multivariate analysis, sampling methods, and causal inference.  Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R/Python and various data processing and Machine Learning libraries.  Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL.  Experience in producing powerful visualizations and dashboards that balance both art and science (using Tableau/D3, etc)  Strong communication skills and the ability to naturally explain difficult technical topics to everyone from data scientists to engineers, to business partners and leaders.  Ability and comfort working independently and making key decisions on projects.  Description  Work with internal partners and cross-functional teams to define and refine business and research questions and use analytics, data mining, statistical techniques and ML to address those questions. Conduct end-to-end analyses across all AppleCare touch points, including data gathering from large and complex datasets, and analyses using advanced statistical and ML methods. - Drive the generation of insights from raw, unstructured data to improve existing features and explore future directions. - Identify content, navigation and user experience elements that impact customer satisfaction via deep analysis, A/B testing and multivariate testing approaches. Present findings from analytics and research and make recommendations to leadership and cross-functional business partners. - Develop extensive knowledge of existing metrics. Create new metrics for performance measurement and advocate for changes to existing metrics where needed. - Lead data science & analytics projects through their entire lifecycle, including problem identification, scope management, analytics design, data gathering, data processing, analysis, algorithm design, deployment, measurement, and report generation. - Partner with peers to build and prototype analytics pipelines that provide insights at scale. - Evangelize adoption of best practices and build greater awareness of common data analysis pitfalls.  Education & Experience  Advanced degree (MS or PhD preferred) in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Operations Research, Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Bioinformatics, Economics or similar  Additional Requirements

Currently enrolled in an Associate or greater degree program (e.g., Associate’s degree, Bachelor’s degree) with a graduation conferral date between August 2021 and September 2022     Experience with one of the following programming languages: Java, Python, Ruby, Node.js, C#, or C++     Experience with Networking fundamentals, Databases (Relational and/or NoSQL), Operating Systems (Unix, Linux, and/or Windows)     Job summary   Do you want to experiment with innovative technologies, including Cloud Computing, Machine Learning, and Internet of Things? Are you passionate about educating, training, designing, and building enterprise cloud computing solutions for a diverse and challenging set of customers? This is a unique opportunity for driven self-starters to play a key role in a fast-growing business and to deliver significant value to AWS customers of all sizes from nimble startups to global brands.      The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that helps AWS customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries. In addition to working alongside our customers, we share our experience through tech talk webinars, White Papers, and blog posts that are available to anyone.        Job Responsibilities:    As an Associate Professional Services Consultant, you will partner with customers and several AWS teams to craft highly scalable, flexible and resilient cloud architectures that address customer business problems. As a trusted customer advocate, you will help organizations understand best practices around cloud-based solutions, and how to migrate existing workloads to the cloud. You will have the opportunity to help shape and execute a strategy to build min-share and broad use of AWS within organizations.      All of our Professional Services Consultants are positioned along tracks like:         Application Developer – AppDev resources are specialists in designing applications that run natively in the cloud. They are experts in building programs that run on any number of platforms including virtualized instances, containers, or server less architecture.     Cloud Infrastructure Architect – An expert in cloud-based networking and system rollouts. CIAs specialize in network performance, infrastructure provisioning, and building Application Programming Interfaces (APIs).     DevOps Specialist – A leader in building advanced computing systems that harness continuous integration/continuous deployment pipelines and utilize the strengths of cloud computing to build scalable and economical systems for customers.     Data Lake & Analytics Specialist – This role will specifically focus on data processing capabilities and helping our customers and partners to remove the constraints that prevent our customers from leveraging their data to develop business insights. Engagements will include migration of existing applications and development of new applications using AWS cloud services.     Data Warehouse & MPP Specialist – This role will specifically focus on large scale data warehousing and database migration capabilities. Engagements will include Redshift implementations and helping customers to migrate from their existing on-premises data warehouses using other databases to Amazon Redshift.     Data & Machine Learning Engineer – In this role, you will work with our partners and customers with a focus on our AWS Analytics services offering such Amazon Kinesis, AWS Glue, Amazon Redshift, Amazon EMR, Athena, AWS ML, and more.     Enrolled in a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fields     Excellent communication skills and ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions to both large and small audiences     Experience implementing a cloud-based technology solution in a school project or while working for a company     Experience with one or more of the following domains: Big Data, Analytics, Security, DevOps, Application Development, or Machine Learning     Awareness of AWS or cloud computing     Demonstrated ability to quickly learn and apply new technologies     Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us      Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. job_title: Global Product Manager - Datacom Specialty Solutions (Remote)
job_Description: Description         Molex creates connections for life by enabling technologies that transform the future and improve lives. With a presence in more than 40 countries, Molex offers a complete range of connectivity products, services and solutions for the data communications, medical, industrial, automotive and consumer electronics industries.     Molex is currently hiring a  Global Product Manager  to join our Enterprise Product Team that supports Product Design for our Datacom Specialty Solutions (DSS) division. Our Data Solutions Engineering division within Molex develops products across telecommunications, datacom, hyperscalers, network and storage solutions. Current technology trends, such as 5G implementation, artificial intelligence, machine learning and the increasing reach of the internet of things, all rely on data and the DSS product development team plays a key role in the transition to the next generation of standards and components.        The Global Product Manager position will be responsible for managing the product life cycle of the product portfolio, from inception until end of life. This role has a global reach and will work closely with global customers, sales, and engineering team to assure that our product development aligns to our customer expectations. The Global Product Manager will have responsibility and empowerment for decisions within the assigned product lines, while also allowing for creative thinking and problem solving.     This position can be remote with expected travel up to 20%.     What You Will Do In Your Role         Develops and implements strategic product and annual business plans targeting markets, industries and customers.      Leads P&L for their product line which will include: long term product planning, cost reduction activities, review and approval of price requests, maintaining price systems and building out price strategies for assigned product lines, participation in global negotiations with key customers, and improvement of profit and market share of assigned product lines.      Tracks capacity and drives capital investments supporting forecasted demand.      Creates and drives long-term product strategy: identifies product line trends and technologies, manages product development activity associated with extending and growing the life of assigned product line and meets with existing customers to deepen relationship and create new opportunities.      Establishes and develops industry partner relationships.      Understands, supports and contributes to current Molex Total Quality Management (TQM), Six Sigma, International Standards Organization (ISO) and Environmental, and/or Health and Safety (EH&S) Management Systems by following stated policies and procedures.        The Experience You Will Bring     Requirements:         Experience in technology serving Data center, telecom, server, storage, networking equipment or AI/ML      Experience with P&L (Profit and loss statement)      Experience in sales      Experience working with international teams      Ability to travel up to 25%      This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship      High School diploma or equivalent               What Will Put You Ahead         Bachelors degree or higher in Business or Engineering      Experience leading and influencing others      Technical background      SAP experience                     Our goal is for each employee, and their families, to live fulfilling and healthy lives. We provide essential resources and support to build and maintain physical, financial, and emotional strength - focusing on overall wellbeing so you can focus on what matters most. Our benefits plan includes - medical, dental, vision, flexible spending and health savings accounts, life insurance, ADD, disability, retirement, paid vacation/time off, educational assistance, and may also include infertility assistance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Specific eligibility criteria is set by the applicable Summary Plan Description, policy or guideline and benefits may vary by geographic region. If you have questions on what benefits apply to you, please speak to your recruiter.        At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy.      For this role, we anticipate paying $ 80,000 - $150,000 per year. This role is eligible for variable pay, issued as a monetary bonus or in another form.        Equal Opportunity Employer.   Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.   This employer uses E-Verify. When you join Verizon        Verizon is one of the world's leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We're a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.        What you’ll be doing...        You’ll help us to find great talent with the experience and potential to make a difference for our customers and drive our business forward. Your approach to identifying and engaging prospective talent will demonstrate our belief that people are our most important asset. You will gather and analyze talent market data, understand current industry trends, and provide strategic insights to key partners to implement effective talent sourcing solutions. Using your talent market knowledge, recruiting tools, professional networks or niche communities, and external partnerships you will craft a strong sourcing strategy to cultivate pipelines of candidates and grow our talent community. The people you bring will become a part of our community of talented, driven individuals that make Verizon a great place to work.         Partnering with a recruiting and hiring team to clarify their talent needs and what success looks like.      Locating new places and new ways to source the best people in the competitive market for talent.      Engaging prospective talent via email and phone about open jobs and building brand affinity within your network and with external service providers.      Performing initial candidate outreach to determine proficiency in specific skills.      Identifying and participating in relevant professional networks, communities, and associations to develop talent market and sourcing expertise in targeted skills.      Staying proactive in the Sourcing community, keeping up with relevant trends and conferences.      Developing strategies to generate differentiated talent in emerging roles or highly competitive talent pools to meet long-term business needs.      Gathering and analyzing talent market data to build comprehensive sourcing strategies and solutions for business.      Identifying and engaging candidates with technical and specialized skills to fill job openings across the business organization.      Finding and presenting the best candidates for consideration.      Maintaining compliance with our process and standards.        Where you'll be working…     In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.        What we’re looking for...        You’ll know how to utilize a variety of talent sourcing strategies and tools to deliver a diverse pool of talent to meet the needs of the current role and who can also grow with us. You enjoy the challenge of matching individuals to roles and helping them to see how they’ll fit in and thrive at Verizon. You’ll enjoy collaborating with recruiters and hiring managers to bring great talent to their hiring teams. You are data savvy and can leverage insights to inform and enhance diverse strategies. You commit to maintaining subject matter expertise in current talent market conditions and sourcing trends.  You’ll need to have:         Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.      Three or more years of relevant work experience.      Proactive and on-demand talent sourcing experience.        Even better if you have one or more of the following:         A degree.      Two or more years of experience with sourcing talent for current or future business hiring needs within the areas of software and application development, network and systems engineering, cloud, business intelligence, data science, cybersecurity, artificial intelligence, or machine learning.      Experience sourcing top talent for a variety of roles in a competitive market.      Experience using Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS).      Experience withCandidate Relationship Management (CRM) tools for sourcing.      Experience with tracking and managing pipelines of candidates.      Experience using recruiting tools including but not limited to LinkedIn, Indeed, HireEz, Handshake, and others.      Recruited at an agency or executive search firm experience.      Exercised effective influence, consulting, and negotiating skills.           Equal Employment Opportunity        We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. THE COMPANY:      Zebit is a San Diego, California based eCommerce and buy-now-pay-later company that is dedicated to making a fundamental change in the lives of over 120 million U.S. credit-challenged consumers by giving them access to purchase a broad set of products and the ability to finance them over six months without any interest, hidden fees, or penalties.      Zebit was founded in 2015, operates in all 50 States across the US, and has demonstrated a solid track record of growth. Zebit has a streamlined operating model that offers over 170,000 products across 25 product categories through its fully integrated drop-ship partner network Zebit has raised over $80M in capital. The Company is poised to become profitable in FY23, with an opportunity for every employee to participate in the upside via a combination of base, stock options, and benefits.      Proudly voted one of the Best Places to Work by the San Diego Business Journal, Zebit is looking for innovative and energetic people to join our team.      Learn more at www.zebit.com      POSITION OVERVIEW:      Reporting initially to the CEO, the Director of Credit Risk will be a hands-on, analytically driven, and seasoned credit operator responsible for setting Zebit’s overall risk appetite and credit policy for acquisitions, collections, fraud mitigation, and account management. The Director will suggest improvements to Zebit’s product structure and enhancements to the machine learning models that govern risk. The Director must have deep experience forecasting loss rates for monthly static pools, and building metrics that communicate and describe the overall health of the portfolio at any point of time.      The Director will work alongside the Head of Data Science on underwriting criteria to acquire new customers and account management strategies to reward or hedge against existing customer behavior and implement. The Director will also create a framework to monitor risk models, while building a reliable methodology to forecast initial bad debt on monthly revenue vintages and understand the signals that cause variances over time. In addition, the Director will manage the Fraud Operations team that is accountable for evaluating new technologies to prevent and detect fraud across the platform. The Director must be adept at doing the work without an initial team of analysts and knowing when to leverage shared resources to accomplish goals. Familiarity with machine learning, big data, and similar advanced analytical tools is preferred.      To be successful, the Director will need deep experience in financial services, specifically subprime lending, and advanced knowledge in using alternative credit, behavioral, and other data to model credit risk over the lifecycle of an account and across a portfolio. Candidates with experience from data centric lenders that serve credit challenged populations are highly preferred.      REQUIREMENTS:          Develop and iterate credit policies across new customer acquisition, account management, fraud management and collections; use champion/challenger learnings to manage credit and fraud risk      Directly query databases and generate analysis to guide decision making and hypothesis testing      Provide credit oversight and clear guidance to the organization on risk appetite and prudent growth      Provide analytics at segment levels for the purpose of monitoring, making policy adjustments and provide sound credit decisions with the ultimate goal of optimizing risk and rewards      Develop, manage, and maintain accurate credit loss forecast model methodologies and model governance      Work with Data Science to determine and revise underwriting criteria used in credit risk models and understand the tradeoffs of such criteria on revenue vs bad debt      Drive the company-wide fraud risk strategy and evaluate technologies and tools to minimize the risk      Lead collections strategies to improve cash collected post purchase      Set procedures to monitor the risk performance and proactively optimize for profitability      Work with external vendors to prioritize and manage product evaluation and data studies      Collaborate with cross-functional teams to explore new ways of finding insights from data and to ensure alignment on priorities      Regularly work with senior leadership (C-Suite) team members to manage expectations around delivery and present solutions      Perform other duties and/or special projects as assigned             MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:          Bachelor’s degree (required) or advanced degree (preferred) in a quantitative field (mathematics, statistics, computer science, engineering, etc.)      10+ years of experience in Credit Risk, Fraud Risk, Data Science, Operations Analytics, Modeling, or related field      Proven analytical work experience in Financial Services, preferably at a FinTech company, building and managing risk strategies for various credit products (loans, lines of credit, credit cards, etc.)      Strong analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving skills with an ability to make data-based decisions      Advanced SQL programming skills      Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau (preferred), Power BI or Qlik      Experience setting credit policy and model governance strategies and metrics in accordance with fair lending and other compliance areas      Experience in fraud prevention and detection utilizing custom bult models and third-party SaaS platforms      Experience in high-volume credit transactions (e.g., POS rather than mortgage or auto)      Excellent communication skills and ability to interface with multiple stakeholders and senior leadership (C-suite) across the organization      Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment      Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the U.S. on a full-time basis      Candidates located in : IL, NY, NJ, CO, & MA will not be considered at this time.

When you join Verizon        Verizon is one of the world's leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We're a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.        What you’ll be doing...        Verizon Connect is transforming the way people, vehicles and things move through the world. We put innovation, automation and connected data to work for customers to help them become safer, more efficient and more productive via our fleet management products and services. Whether it’s an in-cabin smart dashcam, a mobile app for pre-trip inspections, a tablet carried around the job site, or a display on the office wall showing the status of the entire fleet, our IoT experience spans multiple contexts and industries, serving small family businesses to large enterprises all over the globe.     We’re looking for a Quantitative UX Researcher to join our global experience team. You will be working closely with product and business operation teams and contribute throughout the entire product development life cycle. Collaboration is key to our success, and user research is one of many key players in creating a better connected product experience. You’ll be expected to leverage a variety of quantitative techniques to capture and share research often, and to partner with teams to make sure findings are actionable. We encourage a detail-oriented approach and a sense of autonomy, as you will be expected to think critically and guide your stakeholders through research insights.         Working closely with your manager and cross-functional stakeholders to impact all stages of product development.      Investigating user intent and behavior using a variety of research and analytical methods.      Working closely with colleagues in the customer intelligence and insights team to make sure quantitative findings are incorporated into their studies.      Partnering with business intelligence analysts, data scientists, and engineers to create and share research.      Helping the wider global experience team to become experts on user behavior.      Empowering your fellow researchers to break out of silos, socialize research across Verizon Connect, and raise the bar on quality of research work.        Where you'll be working...     This hybrid role will have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days as set by the manager.        What we’re looking for...        You’ll need to have:         Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.      Four or more years of relevant work experience.      Experience working with data sets (e.g., SQL, data cleaning).      Experience planning and conducting quantitative studies.      Experience with descriptive and inferential statistics (e.g., t-tests, ANOVAs, and regression analysis), and statistical analysis software (e.g., JASP, Python, R, and/or SPSS).        Even better if you have one or more of the following:         Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience in Business Intelligence, Customer Insights, Data Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors, Innovation, Market Research, Psychology, or a related field.      Master’s or Ph.D. degree in a related field (equivalent to years of experience).      Knowledge of the importance of collaboration, whether with other researchers or with product and engineering professionals on an integrated team.      Experience working on hardware products & services, particularly IoT (Internet of Things).      Experience with survey design and knowledge of psychometric techniques.      Experience with machine learning models, especially sentiment and categorical analysis.      Experience with data visualization and working with related software (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI).      Experience as a researcher with demonstrated experience conducting lean UX research within a product team.      Workshop facilitation skills, both remote and in person, and with a variety of participants including executives.      Experience working in global teams across multiple time zones. The future will not be televised. It will be streamed. Help us make it happen.  Roku is changing how the world watches TV  Roku is the #1 TV streaming platform in the US, and we've set our sights on powering every television in the world. Roku pioneered streaming to the TV. Our mission is to be the TV streaming platform that connects the entire TV ecosystem. We connect consumers to the content they love, enable content publishers to build and monetize large audiences, and provide advertisers unique capabilities to engage consumers.  From your first day at Roku, you'll make a valuable — and valued — contribution. We're a fast-growing public company where no one is a bystander. We offer you the opportunity to delight millions of TV streamers around the world while gaining meaningful experience across a variety of disciplines.  About the role  The data and advertising group at Roku is looking for seasoned backend engineer with a background in machine learning to improve our ad experiences. Examples of such problems include improving ad-relevance, inferring demographics, yield optimization and many more. Employees in this role are expected to apply knowledge of experimental methodologies, statistics, optimization, probability theory and machine learning using code for tool building, statistical analysis and modeling, using both general purpose software and statistical languages.  What you'll be doing   ML-Infrastructure: Help build a first-class machine learning platform from the ground up which helps manage the entire model lifecycle: feature engineering, model training/evaluation, versioning, deployment/online serving and monitoring prediction quality.  Data Analysis/Feature Engineering: Apply your expertise to identify and calculate features that can be leveraged by multiple use cases as well as models.  Model training with batch and real-time prediction scenarios: Use machine learning and statistical modeling techniques such as Decision Trees, Logistic Regression, Bayesian Analysis, Neural Networks and others to develop and evaluate algorithms to improve product/system performance, quality and accuracy.  Low level systems debugging, performance measurement & optimization on large production clusters.  We're excited if you have   First-hand experience in applied machine learning on real use cases (brownie points for ad-tech related use cases!).  Experience with ML/distributed ML frameworks like Spark-MLlib, TensorFlow etc.  Experience with real-time scoring/evaluation of models with low latency constraints.  Great coding skills and strong software development experience (we use Spark, Scala and Java a lot).  Can work with large scale computing frameworks, data analysis systems and modeling environments. Examples include technologies like Spark, Hive, NoSQL stores etc.  Bachelors, Masters or PhD program in Computer Science/Statistics or a related field.  Ad-tech background is a plus.  The Roku culture  Roku is a great place for people who want to work in a fast-paced environment where everyone is focused on the company's success rather than their own. We try to surround ourselves with people who are great at their jobs, who are easy to work with, and who keep their egos in check. We appreciate a sense of humor. We believe a fewer number of very talented folks can do more for less cost than a larger number of less talented teams. We're independent thinkers with big ideas who act boldly, move fast and accomplish extraordinary things through collaboration and trust. In short, at Roku you'll be part of a company that's changing how the world watches TV.   We have a unique culture that we are proud of. We think of ourselves primarily as problem-solvers, which itself is a two-part idea. We come up with the solution, but the solution isn't real until it is built and delivered to the customer. That penchant for action gives us a pragmatic approach to innovation, one that has served us well since 2002.   #LI-MT2

With a wide range of hot and cold beverages that meet virtually any consumer need, KDP key brands include Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® and The Original Donut Shop®. The Company employs more than 25,000 employees and operates more than 120 offices, manufacturing plants, warehouses and distribution centers across North America.              Benefits built for you: Our people are the heart of our business, which is why we offer robust benefits to support your health and wellness as well as your personal and financial well-being. job_title: Healthcare Economics Consultant, Data Science - Telecommute
job_Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing  your life's best work.(sm)      This role is in Optum Care’s Healthcare Economics (HCE) team primarily serving the Care Delivery Organization (CDO) markets located in Texas and Florida. As part of the Texas and Florida HCE Affordability team, you will work with both Optum National HCE and local CDO SME’s to deliver products identifying healthcare affordability savings opportunities. This position will report to the HCE Affordability Associate Director of the Texas and Florida region.      This individual will have access to one of the largest healthcare databases in the world. An ideal candidate will have a natural curiosity and excitement to deeply explore these databases and uncover insights hidden in plain sight. As a result, an especially strong candidate will possess the technical ability to efficiently navigate and wield this data to create quantitative models identifying healthcare affordability savings opportunities. Importantly, an ideal candidate would also understand the challenges of working with real-world data and know how to set both realistic expectations and realistic solutions.      You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.      Primary Responsibilities:           With strategic speed, create quantitative models to identify affordability savings opportunities       Develop a pipeline of testable analytical ideas for identifying affordability savings opportunities       Query SQL databases to build training data sets and provide analytical reports       Coordinate with partner Optum HCE SME’s to identify or enhance affordability savings opportunities       Regularly engage customers and stakeholders for providing feedback, delivering project updates, and brainstorming ideas       Support other on-going national HCE projects by providing technical expertise            You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.      Required Qualifications:           2+ years of experience using R or Python       2+ years of experience fitting predictive statistical models or machine learning models       Proficient using data science related packages. Python examples: Scikit Learn, NumPy, etc. R Examples: tidyverse, mlr3, caret, ggplot2, etc.       Proficient querying SQL-based databases for building analytical data sets       Proficient wrangling, cleaning, joining, and analyzing large and complex data sets       Adept at presenting technical findings to both a technical and general audience          Preferred Qualifications:           Graduate degree in an applied research field. Ability to perform independent research in a real-world environment       Experience analyzing healthcare data       Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance             To protect the health and safety of our workforce, patients and communities we serve, UnitedHealth Group and its affiliate companies now require all employees to disclose COVID-19 vaccination status prior to beginning employment. In addition, some roles require full COVID-19 vaccination as an essential job function. UnitedHealth Group adheres to all federal, state and local COVID-19 vaccination regulations as well as all client COVID-19 vaccination requirements and will obtain the necessary information from candidates prior to employment to ensure compliance. Candidates must be able to perform all essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation. Failure to meet the vaccination requirement may result in rescission of an employment offer or termination of employment.      Careers with Optum.  Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do y  our life's best work.(sm)      Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only:  The salary range for Colorado residents is $64,800 to $116,000. The salary range for Connecticut / Nevada residents is $71,400 to $127,400. No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.      *All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.         Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected bylower 48 law.
